TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit CipherData extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Represents the element in XML encryption. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The CipherData class represents the `<CipherData>` element in XML encryption. It is a required element that provides the encrypted data. It must either contain the encrypted data as base64-encoded text of the `<CipherValue>` element, or provide a reference to an external location containing the encrypted data using the `<CipherReference>` element.
In many cases, you do not need to directly create a new instance of the CipherData class. The <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.SignedXml.EncryptedXml%2A>, <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.EncryptedData>, and <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.EncryptedKey> classes create instances for you.
> [!NOTE] > A CipherData object can have either a <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.CipherReference> property or a <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.CipherData.CipherValue%2A> property, but not both. A <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.CryptographicException> is thrown if both are assigned to a CipherData object.
## Examples The following code example uses the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.EncryptedData> class to create an <`EncryptedData`> element that contains a <`CipherData`> element, and then writes the XML to an XML file.
[!code-cpp[cryptgraphy.Xml.EncryptedData#1](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/t-system.security.crypto_27_1.cpp)] [!code-vb[cryptgraphy.Xml.EncryptedData#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.security.crypto_27_1.vb)] [!code-cs[cryptgraphy.Xml.EncryptedData#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.security.crypto_27_1.cs)]

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This constructor creates a <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.CipherData> object that represents the `<CipherData>` element in XML encryption. The `<CipherData>` element is a required element in XML encryption.
## Examples The following code example shows how to create a new instance of the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.CipherData> class. The entire sample can be found in the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.CipherData> class topic.
[!code-cpp[cryptgraphy.Xml.EncryptedData#2](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/m-system.security.crypto_12_1.cpp)] [!code-vb[cryptgraphy.Xml.EncryptedData#2](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/m-system.security.crypto_12_1.vb)] [!code-cs[cryptgraphy.Xml.EncryptedData#2](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/m-system.security.crypto_12_1.cs)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(unsigned int8[] cipherValue) cil managed

Docs.param: The encrypted data to use for the element.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class using a byte array as the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.CipherData.CipherValue%2A> value.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This constructor creates a <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.CipherData> object that represents the `<CipherData>` element in XML encryption. The constructor assigns the `cipherValue` value to the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.CipherData.CipherValue%2A> property as the actual encrypted data.
> [!NOTE] > The `<CipherData>` element can have either a <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.CipherReference> or a <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.CipherData.CipherValue%2A> child element, but not both. A <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.CryptographicException> is thrown if both are assigned to a <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.CipherData> object.
## Examples The following code example shows how to create a new instance of the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.CipherData> class.
[!code-cs[cryptography.Xml.EncryptedData2#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/m-system.security.crypto_56_1.cs)] [!code-cpp[cryptography.Xml.EncryptedData2#1](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/m-system.security.crypto_56_1.cpp)] [!code-vb[cryptography.Xml.EncryptedData2#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/m-system.security.crypto_56_1.vb)]

Docs.exception: The <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.CipherData.CipherValue%2A> property has already been set.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.CipherReference cipherReference) cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class using a object.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This constructor creates a <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.CipherData> object that represents the `<CipherData>` element in XML encryption and assigns the `cipherReference` value to the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.CipherReference> property. The <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.CipherReference> object represents the `<CipherReference>` element, which provides the location of the encrypted data.
> [!NOTE] > A <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.CipherData> object can have either a <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.CipherReference> property or a <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.CipherData.CipherValue%2A> property, but not both. A <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.CryptographicException> is thrown if both are assigned to a <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.CipherData> object.
## Examples The following code example shows how to create a new instance of the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.CipherData> class using <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.CipherReference> information.
[!code-vb[cryptography.Xml.CipherReference#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/05ff695b-fd83-4697-9e55-_1.vb)] [!code-cs[cryptography.Xml.CipherReference#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/05ff695b-fd83-4697-9e55-_1.cs)] [!code-cpp[cryptography.Xml.CipherReference#1](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/05ff695b-fd83-4697-9e55-_1.cpp)]

Docs.exception: The <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.CipherData.CipherValue%2A> property has already been set.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The `<CipherReference>` element identifies a source which, when processed, yields the encrypted data. For more information about this element, see <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.CipherReference>.
> [!NOTE] > A <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.CipherData> object can have either a <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.CipherReference> property or a <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.CipherData.CipherValue%2A> property, but not both. A <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.CryptographicException> is thrown if both are assigned to a <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.CipherData> object.
## Examples The following code example shows how to create a new instance of the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.CipherData> class using <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.CipherReference> information.
[!code-vb[cryptography.Xml.CipherReference#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.security.crypto_76_1.vb)] [!code-cs[cryptography.Xml.CipherReference#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.security.crypto_76_1.cs)] [!code-cpp[cryptography.Xml.CipherReference#1](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/p-system.security.crypto_76_1.cpp)]

remarks.format:

> [!NOTE] > The `<CipherData>` element can have either a <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.CipherReference> or a CipherValue child element, but not both. A <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.CryptographicException> is thrown if both are assigned to a <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.CipherData> object.
